metadata.Title: CVE-2011-4622 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The create_pit_timer function in arch/x86/kvm/i8254.c in KVM 83, and possibly other versions, does not properly handle when Programmable Interval Timer (PIT) interrupt requests (IRQs) when a virtual interrupt controller (irqchip) is not available, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) by starting a timer. BUG: unable to handle kernel NULL pointer dereference at 0000000000000128 IP: [<ffffffffa10f6280>] kvm_set_irq+0x30/0x170 [kvm] ... Call Trace:  [<ffffffffa11228c1>] pit_do_work+0x51/0xd0 [kvm]  [<ffffffff81071431>] process_one_work+0x111/0x4d0  [<ffffffff81071bb2>] worker_thread+0x152/0x340  [<ffffffff81075c8e>] kthread+0x7e/0x90  [<ffffffff815a4474>] kernel_thread_helper+0x4/0x10 A flaw was found in KVM's Programmable Interval Timer (PIT). When a virtual interrupt control is not available a local user could use this to cause a denial of service by starting a timer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-4622` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
